result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jordan E Helgerson

records.addlTxt: Waiver of Prelim on November 14, 2022 at 10:45 am.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Clerk: Amy. 
Called:  11:15 a.m. 
INCLUDES 21CM535, 22CF860.
State appears by ADA Lacey Coonen. 
Defendant appears in person with Atty Thomas Roley. 

Date and time set for plea/sentencing; VRCW. 
Parties advise there is not a global agreement; however request to proceed with plea in 21CM535.

Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights filed in 21CM535. 
COURT advises defendant of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & questions defendant to understanding.

PLEA: 
Count 1 (Disorderly Conduct)>>GUILTY.  

COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & voluntary made, a factual basis & defendant guilty.

COURT ORDERS: $100.00 fine plus court costs including DNA sample/surcharge. 

ADA Coonen requests preliminary hearing be set on 22CF860.  
COURT sets waiver of prelim for 11/14/22 at 10:45 a.m. 

Adj:  11:24 a.m.

Clerk: Amy. 
Called:  11:15 a.m. 
INCLUDES 21CM535, 22CF860.
State appears by ADA Lacey Coonen. 
Defendant appears in person with Atty Thomas Roley. 

Date and time set for plea/sentencing; VRCW. 
Parties advise there is not a global agreement; however request to proceed with plea in 21CM535.

Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights filed in 21CM535. 
COURT advises defendant of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & questions defendant to understanding.

PLEA: 
Count 1 (Disorderly Conduct)>>GUILTY.  

COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & voluntary made, a factual basis & defendant guilty.

COURT ORDERS: $100.00 fine plus court costs including DNA sample/surcharge. 

ADA Coonen requests preliminary hearing be set on 22CF860.  
COURT sets waiver of prelim for 11/14/22 at 10:45 a.m. 

Adj:  11:24 a.m.

No contact with victim(s): J.R.B., A.A.P., T.S.T. Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney. No Bars, Taverns, Liquor Stores or Beer Tents. Absolute sobriety from and no possession of alcohol. Shall have his/her fingerprints and photograph taken at the Sheriff's Dept.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt:
Clerk: Heather. 
Case called: 2:17 p.m. 

State appears by ADA Alex Lech.  Defendant appears from MCJ via Zoom, with Atty Paige Metzman, in person.

Date and time set for initial appearance. VRCW.  
Reading Waived.  Reserve Jurisdiction. 
Court questions deft re: complaint and rights.
Advised Right of Counsel. 
Prelim Time Limits Waived. 

COURT ORDERS: $1,000.00 signature bond.

CONDITIONS: 
- No contact with victim(s): J.R.B., A.A.P., T.S.T.
- No Bars, Taverns, Liquor Stores, or Beer Tents, other than place of employment during work hours. 
- Absolute sobriety from and no possession of alcohol.  
- Prints and photograph. 

Deft notes Atty Roley is appointed to him on his other cases.
COURT appoints Atty Thomas Roley to this case too under the same repayment order.

DATES:
PLEAS: 8/11/22 @ 11:15 p.m. Br. 4.

Adjourned: 2:23 p.m.
